. It's a very small roadstrip town with not much interest in itself, especially when it packs up with tourists in the summer. But it's a good place to stop to get equipment and supplies, and north of town there's whitewater rafting. Further up
you can find beautiful areas both down in the valley and up in the hills.
there are several buses each day operated by Setesdal Bilruter
. A handful daily routes continue on to Haukeli, with connections to Bergen.
Usually you arrive in Evje by car from
, the quickest is to go around through

.

Bicycle is also a popular alternative, but the main north/south road can be a bit trafficked.
7 km north of the town provides both guiding and rental for whitewater and mountain activities.
Not too much to choose from.

value: content=Located in the town center has 12 decent rooms, prices are varying from NOK600 upwards.
sell accommodation and activity packages. You have to inquire for prices - starting from NOK850.
